IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Global Media Outreach presents the Good News of Jesus Christ online 24/7.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Global Media Outreach presents the Good News of Jesus Christ online 24/7, provides personal response through online missionaries to people seeking, and helps new and recommitting believers grow in their faith through discipleship online.
IRS990.Desc: Global Media Outreach's ministry takes place online via websites, social media, and mobile apps. As such, expenses incurred for the three largest program accomplishments cannot be stated separately.(1)Reach: Global Media Outreach leverages Internet advertising on platforms such as Google, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and many other Internet platforms to engage people with the Gospel through felt-need issues.In Fiscal Year 2023, we had over 201,000,000 Gospel presentations in over 13 languages across the globe.(2)Share: We share the Gospel on native social platforms or redirect people to a website landing page where they can hear the full Gospel and are presented with an opportunity to receive Christ as their Lord and Savior. In Fiscal year 2023, we had over 18,500,000 indicated decisions for Christ.(3)Grow: Global Media Outreach helps individuals grow in their faith with online resources available through our websites, social media, and email. Whether someone has just accepted Christ, rededicated their life to God, or still has questions, GMO also has thousands of volunteers who provide prayer, guidance, and discipleship. In Fiscal year 2023, we received over 1.5 million new contacts who wanted to engage more deeply to grow in their faith.In addition to this work, we made strategic investments in our discipleship response platform, PATH, to allow our volunteer online missionaries to engage better and track the progress of individuals who have spiritual questions or want to grow in their new faith. We also developed a robust training program for all our volunteer online missionaries and created new video ads and discipleship content. Lastly, we updated all our Explore God materials and technology to allow us to facilitate local community outreachinitiativesthrough local churches.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Expenditures are accounted for using the accrual method of accounting.

Global Media Outreach's Ministry takes place on the World Wide Web. The primary means of reaching worldwide populations is through the placement of advertisements, the primary program service expense, on numerous websites in numerous languages. Because of the mobility and diversity of the populations reached, it is not possible to correlate specific expenses incurred with a specific geographic region. For example, the spanish language advertisements are primarily reaching spanish speaking people in Central and South America while populations in regions of North America and Sub-Saharan Africa are responding primarily to english language advertisements. Once a person has responded to an advertisement by clicking the link on the website, the person is redirected to Global Media Outreach's own website which is maintained in the United States. Should a respondent want additional contact with a missionary, the communication takes place through Global Media Outreach's email server which is also located in the United States.

The management of Global Media Outreach selects organizations to give money to based on their like-minded goals of sharing the Good News of Jesus Christ. A review of an organization's website occurs before funds are given to them to confirm the goals of the organization align with GMO.

During the reporting period, A. De La Roche, J. Gowler, D. Hammock, and J. Thompson were accompanied by their spouses at the 2022 Vision Summit. The spouse participated in the exempt activity 100% of the time that they accompanied the employee. For this reason the spousal travel is not treated as taxable compensation as it served a bona fide business purpose. Pursuant to Internal Revenue Code Section 107, ministerial housing allowances are provided for qualifying ministerial employees. This is not included in taxable compensation. The President/CEO met the qualifications for and received a ministerial housing allowance during the tax year.
The organization made nonfixed payments in the form of discretionary bonuses.
The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed in detail by the CFO, the Board Finance committee, and then by the full board before it is filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization regularly monitors its compliance with the conflict of interest policy by allowing an interested person to make a presentation at a governing board or committee meeting. Claims are investigated and appropriate action is taken. Additionally, conflict of interest policy disclosures are completed and signed by board members and officers on an annual basis. The disclosures are reviewed by the CFO. The Chairman of the Finance Committee reviews the CFO's annual disclosure. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: On an annual basis, GMO uses Salary.com as well as Form 990s from 4 to 6 similar sized ministries to benchmark compensation. Salaries for the CEO/President, Chairman, and CFO were approved by the Compensation Committee as well as the full Board, which was properly documented in the board minutes. Highest compensated employees' salaries were reviewed and approved by the President.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.

Compensation reported in Part VII, column D and Schedule J, Part II, column B is the amount reported on the individual's W-2, box 1 or 5 (whichever amount is greater) per the IRS instructions. In the case of minister's compensation when box 5 of the W-2 is not applicable, box 1 compensation is used. Employee deferrals to qualified retirement plans are normally captured in box 5, not box 1 of Form W-2. For reporting purposes we have included the minister's retirement plan deferrals in Part VII, column F and Schedule J, Part II, column C.
